Class Logging

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.TraderLight.DayTrader.StockTrader.Logging

  • public class Logging
extends java.lang.Object
    Logging! Will always write to the console, but can specify to also write to a file.
    Author:
    Mario Visco

    • Method Detail

      • setLogLevel

        public static void setLogLevel(org.apache.log4j.Level level)
        Change the logging level from the default value of INFO. This will affect all the loggers that get initialized after changing the level. Should be run before initializing the logger whose level needs changed.
        Parameters:
        level -

      • getLogger

        public static org.apache.log4j.Logger getLogger(boolean writeFile)
        Logging with the option to write to a file. -Uses default filename and output path for empty strings
        Parameters:
        writeFile - - Write to file?
        Returns:
        The log4j Logger to use

      • getDirFromClass

        private static java.lang.String getDirFromClass(java.lang.String callingClass)
        Get the name of the directory we should put our output in from the calling class package. If the last part of the package is 'test' get the second to last part of the package.
        Parameters:
        callingClass -
        Returns:
